link_desc:
What's this?

To deploy Zabbix server 3.0 and Mariadb containers with Docker Compose. This is aimed for quick and easy deployment. Container's images are distributed in the Zabbix repository on Docker Hub: https://hub.docker.com/u/zabbix/ .

Compose's file is written by v2 format. This is useful for manageing volume.

I was inspired by https://github.com/zabbix/zabbix-community-docker .

Requirements

* Docker Engine 1.10+

* Docker Compose 1.6+

How to use

1. make the Compose's project directory and move

mkdir zabbix3
cd zabbix3

2. download docker-compose.yml

3. pull images

$ docker-compose pull

4. run containers as a detouched mode ( with -d ) option.

$ docker-compose up -d
Creating network "zabbix3_default" with the default driver
Creating volume "zabbix3_zabbix-db-storage" with local driver
Creating volume "zabbix3_backups" with local driver
Creating zabbix3_zabbix-db_1
Creating zabbix3_zabbix-server_1

5. check status

$ docker-compose ps
       Name                 Command                State                 Ports
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
zabbix3_zabbix-db_1   /run.sh               Up                    3306/tcp
zabbix3_zabbix-       /config/bootstrap.s   Up                    0.0.0.0:10051->1005
server_1              h                                           1/tcp, 10052/tcp,
                                                                  162/udp,
                                                                  0.0.0.0:80->80/tcp

Finally, you can access by own browser http:/// .

See also,

https://hub.docker.com/r/zabbix/zabbix-3.0/
